(OOC: I'd lke to announce I have finally finished a picture of 
Teltoli.. and everybody cheers! LOLI'm scanning it today, and then 
I'll post it. ^_^)

Teltoli laughed out loud. "I know.. I shouldn't be calling you old. 
But I'm young, and anyone that is a year older than me has to be old" 
She grinned, and looked up at the sky. "Getting dark.." She half-
murmered to herself. 

Not that it really mattered. Her beast form, being half panther, 
could easily see in the dark, and that carried over to her bot form 
as well.

"I'd almost forgotten what night was like on Earth.. without a Base, 
I mean. There were so many artificial lights on Cybertron you 
couldn't see the stars. But here.." The Fuzor trailed off as she 
looked upwards at the Milky Way.

So preoccupied in naming off constellations in her mind, Teltoli 
almost tripped over a lone branch that was laying across their path. 
She yelped and quickly righted heself again, and glared at the 
branch. Then she blushed. 'Good one, Teltoli, now Carnage will think 
you're so stupid you couldn't survive one day out here!' Her mind 
mocked her.

She sniffed and looked back up at the stars again. Her panther tail, 
which was a part of her bot mode, swished gently behind her in small 
movements.

'Geesh, it's a small miracle.. no make that a big miracle, that 
Carnage hasn't tried to get rid of me or anything so far. I must be 
the most annoying bot that anyone has ever met..' Her face soured 
slightly, but she continued looking at the stars over the horizon. 'I 
mean, I'm just turning 19, and she must be.. how old? Maybe in her 
twenties or thirties.. certainly doesn't look it though. And it 
doesn't really matter how old the body is, as long as the mind is 
still active. I guess. But you can't exactly go fighting wars when 
you're eighty.. can you..'

"Ooohh Wow! My Dad used to point out that constellation to me all the 
time! I can't beleive I can see it here.. he used to call it the 
Battle Blade. See those two real bright stars, that's the hilt, and 
the other two are the bottom of the hilt and the tip of the sword" 
(For those in the Southern Hemisphere, think Southern Cross ^_^) She 
pointed out, delight in her voice.
